ai-tha-ap81:1.1_0: “I used to have a small sea
ai-tha-ap81:1.2_0: “In the wilderness, I’m sitting in the wilderness,
ai-tha-ap81:2.1_0: I raised my joined palms to my joined palms,
ai-tha-ap81:2.2_0: went away from Pāvā to see her.
ai-tha-ap81:2.3_0: not far away from the near shore.
ai-tha-ap81:3.1_0: That’s why I’ve heard from theft.
ai-tha-ap81:3.3_0: I’m now a wanted to die.
ai-tha-ap81:3.4_0: and again he raising his hands in respectful salutation,
ai-tha-ap81:4.1_0: On the two occasions when the other goes forth
ai-tha-ap81:4.2_0: Then the Asuraka Kaccānā said this:
ai-tha-ap81:4.3_0: I’m not aware of any living creatures.
ai-tha-ap81:5.2_0: what seers in the deer park at the Deer Park?
ai-tha-ap81:7.1_0: That is how these verses were recited by the senior venerable Jaṭila.
